text:
Hey guys! Any idea how to avoid this?
Why objects in response are not in the same order as in request?

Hi guys!
To avoid the javascript injection, to render my forms in a Wordpress instance, i retrieve them from the Form API, and render them from the backend!

The problem is that some css styling information are not delivered by the API! Form example: When i put two inputs in the same fieldgroup (like the picture below), the API only give the information that they are in the same "fieldgroup". But not the css used to make the hendering in the same line, for example:

The form in HubSpot:
Rendereing with javascript injection:
Rendering in backend:
I know that i can make my own css to achieve this, but why the api dont delivery this?
by the injection i see the classes that provide this .. classes like "hsForm_50aed221-49bd-4b94-97e9-a604a...." or "hs-form-70aed221-49bd-4b94-97e9-a...."

Hi!!
Looking the response, i would say that the response is order by id desc ...
<@U03NJK7A3QU> Yes, but I need correct order) First item in request must be the first item in response. Like in all good batch APIs (e.g. SalesForce or ZohoCRM)

Yes, totally agree with you!
The response also looks more like a "search result" as a "created" response ..
I think those classes are meant more for identification then for styling...
i also, but if i remove them, then i lost the layout ..
i double checked now .. the last of them make it ..

Hello There, I'm making a call to the integrations API to get the portal id of an account and everything works fine but since the info I'm getting is this 'portalId','timeZone', 'accountType','currency', 'utcOffset' and 'utcOffsetMilliseconds'. I would like to know how can I get the actual name of the portal. Does anyone know how to do that?
Yes, I would really like to have a fix for this.
pretty sure its not possible: <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Get-HubsPot-account-name-by-portalId-from-API/m-p/280013>
Has anyone run into CORS issues with a serverless function on HubSpot that uses the Node HubSpot library to call data _from_ HubSpot? Why is this even a issue when the originator is HubSpot itself?
Postman can access the serverless function but for some reason the HubSPot module isn't able to retrieve it.

Solved:

Make sure the HubSpot page is utilizing HTTPS and/or matches the serverless functions protocol.
<@U0336QCR2FQ> You need to make sure the serverless function domain is the same domain that you're using to call the function
so if you're module is going to be used on <https://example.com> the serverless function endpoint should be <https://example.com/_hcms/api/endpoint>
replace endpoint with the name of your serverless function
Thanks so much, Guess I'll use hub_domain instead.

Hey! I am trying to associate a note with attachments to the deal using API. Getting error not sure what I am doing wrong here. Successfully able to upload attachments, create notes with attachments but stuck in this. Could anyone please point what I am doing wrong here? Adding API call and the error response in the thread

`<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v4/objects/engagement/{{note_id}}/associations/deal/{{deal_id}}?hapikey={{api_key}}>`
`{`
    `"status": "error",`
    `"message": "internal error",`
    `"correlationId": "1c9c8059-2364-4994-ac6f-f3139a813005"`
`}`
Tried the above API call with /note instead engagement as well, still the same error.

Resolved, by using v3 api
<https://api.HubSpot.com/crm/v3/objects/note/{{note_id}}/associations/deal/{{deal_id}}/note_to_deal?hapikey={{api_key}}>
